newsitem.title: UK: IPE Brent off lows after NYMEX tests support.
newsitem.headline: IPE Brent off lows after NYMEX tests support.

text.p: IPE Brent crude oil futures recovered slightly on Wednesday after U.S. markets rebounded in early trade, brokers said.

July Brent was eight cents down at 1417 GMT and stood at $18.82 a barrel, while June gas oil was $1.75 down at $168.25 a tonne. NYMEX July crude fell back to support at $20.00 a barrel before recovering to $20.24.
The market fell sharply on Tuesday in anticipation of inventory from the American Petroleum Institute (API) which was released overnight and painted a bearish picture.
"The APIs were mostly factored in yesterday and there was a little follow-through this morning, to the tune of 10-15 cents or so," one IPE dealer said.
"We have got very high refinery activity in the U.S. This is the main fundamental factor in the market. So look for any refinery problems now - they will have a big effect on the market."
API data showed refinery capacity utilisation rose on the week to 98.4 percent from 96.7 percent.
